description.narrative: Output 6: By 2017, juvenile justice laws and policies are consistent with or better than international standards with adequate resource commitment demonstrated., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ General, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: Children are better served by formal and informal gender-sensitive justice processes that aim to protect and support children as victims, witnesses and offenders.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6: By 2017, juvenile justice laws and policies are consistent with or better than international standards with adequateresource commitment demonstrated.

description.narrative: Implementation on the operational Plan for the Justice for Children Policy started in 2017; four regional and one national stakeholder consultations conducted to review laws. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: Finalization of operation plan for the justice for children policy

target.value: 2017:Operational plan costed and finalised and disseminated

actual.value: 2017:Operational plan for justice for children policy has been costed, finalized and disseminated. 80 % of the activities from the plan are ongoing.

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms

target.value: 2017:Juvenile Justice Act and Children's Act amended.

actual.value: 2017:The process for amending the children's Act and the Juvenile Justice Acts are underway with Desk review completed. National and regional consultations have been held.
